channel.title: Command needed Please
channel.description:
I'm here to ask some command you could give me ..
::stats To put all your stat to 99 please , with players rights 2

item.title: Command needed Please
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Yeah, but since you want the command to be ::stats, just replace master with stats.

Read full topic

item.title: Command needed Please
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“tlpkscape, post:2, topic:309617”]i am gonna be honest with you.
if you can’t do a simple command like that…then you really shouldn’t even try…
just go enjoy the servers…[/quote]Then don’t post if you won’t help.

@jamessemple
That won’t work.

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 2) { addskillXp(14000000, 0); addskillXp(14000000, 1); addskillXp(14000000, 2); addskillXp(14000000, 3); addskillXp(14000000, 4); addskillXp(14000000, 5); addskillXp(14000000, 6); addskillXp(14000000, 7); addskillXp(14000000, 8); addskillXp(14000000, 9); addskillXp(14000000, 10); addskillXp(14000000, 11); addskillXp(14000000, 12); addskillXp(14000000, 13); addskillXp(14000000, 14); addskillXp(14000000, 15); addskillXp(14000000, 16); addskillXp(14000000, 17); addskillXp(14000000, 18); addskillXp(14000000, 19); addskillXp(14000000, 20); addskillXp(14000000, 21); }

and if you were smart enough to do it you could make it much, much smaller by using something probably like this

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 2) { for(int i = 0; i < 21; i++) { addSkillXP(14000000, i); }

Read full topic

item.title: Command needed Please
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

lol hes not lying… commands r easy to do buut im nice so ill help u (spelling may be a bit out im just making this from scratch)
try this:

if.commandequals.IgnoreCase("master") && Playerights >=2 { addskillXp(14000000, 0); addskillXp(14000000, 1);
try that and continue it up to number 24
